  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In JIRA Administration (the cog) > System > User Interface: Default User Preferences there is the option to increase the number of issues displayed per Issue Navigator page when viewing Issues in the Issue Navigator. Since JIRA 6.4.x, there is now a limit to the number of Projects that can be viewed in Projects > View All Projects at a time. This limit is currently set to 25.


h3. Suggested Solution
Just as we allow the JIRA Administrator to increase the number of Issues that can be viewed at a time in the Issue Navigator for their users, there should also be an ability to increase the number of Projects that can be viewed in View All Projects.

 
h3. Workaround 
There isn't a way to increase this number at the moment.
fields.summary: Increase Number of Projects Displayed

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The {{currentUser()}} JQL function does not work in the WebHooks JQL

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a request bin as per the KB article [How to collect data for Atlassian Support for troubleshooting Webhook does not include JSON in the POST|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+to+collect+data+for+Atlassian+Support+for+troubleshooting+Webhook+does+not+include+JSON+in+the+POST].
# Create a new WebHook.
# In the webhook configuration, use the newly created bin.
# Add the JQL below and ensure the WebHook is configured for the *Issue Created* event:
{noformat}
reporter = currentUser()
{noformat}
# Create a new issue.

h3. Expected Results
Accessing the request bin, a webhook call should have been logged.

h3. Actual Results
There are no requests in the request bin.
As per our [WebHooks Developer Documentation|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-architecture/webhooks], this limitation should have been fixed on JIRA 5.2.2:
{quote}
h3. Limitations in JQL
* If you are using JIRA 5.2.1 or earlier, there are two known issues/limitations when using JQL with webhooks:
** {{currentUser()}} function does not work as expected.
{quote}
fields.summary: The currentUser JQL function does not work in the WebHook JQL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44113].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The field in the Assign Issue dialog allows for either typing to immediately select somebody, or clicking on the down arrow to scroll through a list of all the users on an instance. If you have enough users on your instance that the dropdown list has a scrollbar, if you scroll to the bottom JIRA appears to query itself for the list of assignable users multiple times, and you end up with duplicate users appearing at the bottom of the list.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 15-20 users in JIRA 6.5-OD-07, ensure all of them are able to be assigned issues (you need enough users to cause the user list in the Assign Issue dialog to have to scroll).
# Create a new JIRA issue.
# Click Assign, then hit the dropdown arrow in the Assignee field.
# Scroll down (using the keyboard or trackpad/mouse, it doesn't matter) to the bottom of the list.

h3. Expected Results
You reach the bottom of the user list and there's no duplicates.

h3. Actual Results
As you get to the bottom of the user list, you'll notice the scrollbar will jump and you'll have a couple of duplicate users appearing at the bottom. This will repeat two or three more times.
 
h3. Notes
You can see the XHRs appearing in the web inspector each time the scrollbar jump happens. The very first XHR when you click the down arrow in the Assignee field will contain all the users with no duplicates, but the subsequent ones will have only one or two users in them, which are the duplicates that appear at the bottom of the list upon scrolling down.

This isn't browser-specific (I can replicate it in Firefox, Chrome, and Safari).

h3.Workaround
Currently there's no workaround, but this issue is purely cosmetic.
fields.summary: Duplicate users appear when scrolling through list of users from the Assign Issue dialog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44107].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When JIRA receives a mail to create issue from another JIRA instance, having X-JIRA-FingerPrint prevents JIRA to create issue and throws the below error in the logs:
{code}
Received message with another JIRA instance's fingerprint
{code}
For more detailed information you can refer to:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+Email+Finger+Print


h3. Suggested Solution
To enable the administrator to have an option to be able to create issues. However, this might lead to loop issues.


(!) This feature is to avoid loop and loop detection so we do not recommend to enable it, unless we get Atlassian Development Team idea about it.

(!) Do note that Atlassian do not support customization as described on the documentation as outlined in our Atlassian Support Offerings. Please only try if you are confident on doing so and we strongly encourage customers to perform the check on test environment first before applying to production.

Explanation By Customer(In the comments):
{quote}
The increasing number of JIRA instances, and how we'd like them to work together, raises an interesting use case for us:
Desired Outcome
What we'd like to do is create issues in our JIRA instance from another organisation's JIRA emails to us. We can't do that because our JIRA handler detects these emails as correctly belonging to another JIRA instance.
Steps:
Organisation A (OrgA) and Organisation B (OrgB) both have their own JIRA instances.
OrgA sends support request email to OrgB
OrgB JIRA mail handler detects email and creates issue (Issue Key ORGB-1)
OrgB sends JIRA issue notification to OrgA
OrgA JIRA mail handler detects email and create issue (Issue Key ORGA-1)
OrgA JIRA local users / groups can use ORGA-1 to track issue progress with OrgB without needing access to OrgB JIRA.
Actual Outcome
Organisation A (OrgA) and Organisation B (OrgB) both have their own JIRA instances.
Steps:
OrgA sends support request email to OrgB
OrgB JIRA mail handler detects email and creates issue (Issue Key ORGB-1)
OrgB sends JIRA issue notification to OrgA
OrgA JIRA mail handler detects email from OrgB and rejects it with the following error in the logs: "Received message with another JIRA instance's fingerprint"
No issue is created in OrgA JIRA.
This would be extremely useful because it allow users or user groups issue visibility and tracking with issues lodged with another organisation's JIRA.
{quote}
fields.summary: To Be Able to Create Issues By JIRA Mail Handler Fingerprint

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44091].
  {panel}

Creating issue with 
"Unicode Character 'LINE SEPARATOR' (U+2028)" in summary breaks issue searcher.
*Steps to reproduce:*
1. go to some page eg. issues->search for issues
2. click create button to create new issue
3. paste text with u+2028 character eg. "Make Payments for sessions  "
the quoted text should have this character at the end, You can check this by going to ge. http://www.url-encode-decode.com/ and encode the string, the output string should have %E2%80%A8 near the end.
4. create issue
5. go back to eg. dashboard
6. return to issues->search for issues
7. the page is broken due to failing JS

after investigation it turned out that the culprit is the old jquery library that we use (i belive 1.7.2) and there is some json string matching there that the string with unicode new line character fails
{code}
var Yb=/^(?:\{.*\}|\[.*\])$/
{code}
and later 
{code}
c="true"===c?!0:"false"===c?!1:"null"===c?null:d.isNumeric(c)?+c:Yb.test(c)?d.parseJSON(c):c
{code}
that fails and returns string instead of parsed json object.

the workaround is to edit specific issue and delete these "invalid" character.
fields.summary: creating issue with utf8 new line character (U+2028) in summary breaks issue search page

fields.description:
When adding an "Active Directory" directory under "User Directories" using a long LDAP filter in the "User Object Filter" it fails due to MySQL database error "(Data truncation: Data too long for column 'attribute_value' at row 1)"

The length of the column *attribute_value* in the table *cwd_directory_attribute* is *255*. Increasing the varchar value *fixes the problem*. 

It will be good to have a higher default value, like 4000 as Crowd has to avoid this errors with long LDAP filters.
fields.summary: Unable to add Active Directory with long User Object Filter

fields.description:
Without digging into exactly what character decoding/encoding is occurring here, you can reproduce the issue with this set of steps:

On Windows 8, put any Emoji into an email message with the Outlook web access client (https://outlook.office365.com/). Copy the character from your message into the system clipboard (select, ctrl c). Paste the emoji character into a Jira field. Save.

Results in trace:

Error creating issue: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:Issue][summary,test][watches,0][creator,twilder][created,2015-06-29 11:37:18.528][timespent,null][timeoriginalestimate,null][project,10105][description,😣][reporter,twilder][type,10001][priority,3][number,2760][environment,null][security,null][timeestimate,null][duedate,null][resolutiondate,null][votes,0][assignee,null][id,17121][updated,2015-06-29 11:37:18.528][workflowId,19521][status,10200] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO jiraissue (ID, pkey, issuenum, PROJECT, REPORTER, ASSIGNEE, CREATOR, issuetype, SUMMARY, DESCRIPTION, ENVIRONMENT, PRIORITY, RESOLUTION, issuestatus, CREATED, UPDATED, DUEDATE, RESOLUTIONDATE, VOTES, WATCHES, TIMEORIGINALESTIMATE, TIMEESTIMATE, TIMESPENT, WORKFLOW_ID, SECURITY, FIXFOR, COMPONENT) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (Incorrect string value: '\xF0\x9F\x98\xA3' for column 'DESCRIPTION' at row 1))

The impact here is that if someone who doesn't know where to look to identify the error copy pastes email contents containing an emoji with whatever encoding Outlook / the Windows clipboard / Google Chrome are using into a JIRA field, they will be frustrated and confused as to why they cannot save their issue.

Arabic characters are fine, so I'm assuming this isn't just a high codepoint issue.
fields.summary: Emoji data can break input fields :(

fields.description:
The EditCustomFieldDefaults action uses a custom field type's CustomFieldTypeModuleDescriptor to get the 'edit-default' template resource.  For velocity templates, the descriptor returns the correct resource.  For soy templates, the descriptor only returns the 'edit' resource.  

This is annoying since getDescriptor() is marked final in AbstractCustomField, so I cannot provide a descriptor that serves up the right template. 

You could call the soy template from velocity, but the better workaround is listed in my comment below.

I'm developing for 6.4.3 at the moment but I didn't see anything in the release notes for subsequent versions that might have anything to do with this.

Edit: this is also an issue for retrieving the 'view' template for the viewissue plugin (browse screen).  The same workaround applies.
fields.summary: CustomFieldTypeModuleDescriptor ignores edit-default resource if template type is soy

h3. Summary
When exporting a Created vs Resolved chart via the Issue Navigator, the chart doesn't follow it's configuration. The configuration states *Cumulative Totals* is set to *Yes* but the chart doesn't display this

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA 6.4.7
# Install JIRA Agile and create a sample project (I used Sample Scrum Project)
#* You can skip this step if you already have a project with multiple Resolved/Unresolved issues
# Navigate to the *Issue Navigator* and search for the project (eg. project = SSP)
# Click {{Export > Charts > Created vs Resolved}}
# Add this gadget to the dashboard

h3. Expected Results
# The chart displayed in the Step 4 is cumulative
# The chart added to the dashboard is cumulative

h3. Actual Results
# The chart displayed in Step 4 is *not* cumulative
!nav.png|thumbnail!
#* The configuration for this is already set to cumulative as can be seen if you click on {{Cog > Edit}}
!nav2.png|thumbnail!
# The chart added to the dashboard is *not* cumulative
!dash.png|thumbnail!
#* This is what the cumulative chart should look like
!dash2.png|thumbnail!
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
Manually *Edit* the chart and click *Save* to change it to cumulative
fields.summary: Created and Resolved Chart via Issue Navigator Export isn't Cumulative as per the configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44045].
  {panel}

There is no way to add watchers while creating a ticket; that's a pretty big shortfall.

To add insult to injury, after entering a new ticket, instead of showing the ticket so you can then add the watchers, only a small banner appears. If you don't click on it fast enough, you have to then search for your ticket, just to add the watchers.

As a developer of systems myself, it would appear to be trivial to collect the watcher ids in a form, post together with the new ticket data, and map the watchers after the ticket is created.

Even more trivially, just redirect to the newly created ticket. This is the standard pattern for any CRUD system, and you're completely breaking it. I read that support teams want this so they can create a ticket without changing their current screen.

OK. then add a checkbox at the bottom of the create ticket screen that defaults to 'Open ticket after creation'. 1 new element, 2 lines of code, 1 extra test.

I also see that there are a lot of complaints about this spanning the last 2 years (really!?) such that there is even a JS plugin hack to get around this unintuitive behaviour.

How hard can that be? About 15 minutes of work?

C'mon guys!
fields.summary: Open ticket after creation or allow watchers to be added when creating ticket

h3. Summary
User Directory synchronization takes a long time deleting the same users on every synchronization.

h3. Environment:
* LDAP Connector directory;
* JIRA 6.4.5.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a LDAP Connector directory
# Create user in the LDAP directory and synchronise with JIRA
# Assign an issue to one LDAP user
# Delete the assigned user from LDAP server
# Synchronise the directory

h3. Expected Results
JIRA should run the delete upon the synchronisation adding the deleted_externally flag to the cwd_user table once.

h3. Actual Results
The expected operation will run upon every synchronisation.
The following is shown in the logs on every synch.
{noformat}
2015-03-26 12:01:55,978 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-1 DEBUG ServiceRunner    [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteChangeOperations] user [ user ] not found, deleting
2015-03-26 12:01:55,978 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-1 INFO ServiceRunner    [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteChangeOperations] scanned and compared [ 10148 ] users for delete in DB cache in [ 7ms ]
2015-03-26 12:01:55,978 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-1 INFO ServiceRunner    [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteChangeOperations] deleting [ 1 ] users
2015-03-26 12:01:55,981 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-1 INFO ServiceRunner    [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteChangeOperations] deleted [ 1 ] users in [ 3ms ]
2015-03-26 12:01:55,981 atlassian-scheduler-quartz1.clustered_Worker-1 INFO ServiceRunner    [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteChangeOperations] scanned for deleted users in [ 10ms ]
{noformat}

h3. Notes
This can make the synchronisation take a long time when a huge amount of users have been deleted from LDAP.
fields.summary: Directory Synch takes a long time trying to delete users

  {panel}

h4. +Usage Clarification+
In [JIRA 6.4 Release Notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+6.4+Release+Notes], under "Click here to read about more JIRA 6.4 features..", it's stated that:
bq. *Paste images* - Previously if you had an attachment or image on your clipboard, you had to save it and add it to a JIRA comment or description as an attachment. Now, you can simply copy it directly to JIRA by using your keyboard shortcut or selecting "Copy" from the right-click menu.

It's not clear which places are covered by "JIRA comment or description" and "copy it directly to JIRA". *Suggestion* is to make it clear that:
{panel}
# Keyboard shortcut can be used to directly paste an image from clipboard to:
#* the Description field in the View Issue screen only (Inline-Edit is required)
#* the Comment field expanded by clicking on the Comment button (either top or bottom) in the View Issue screen only
# Keyboard shortcut can't be used for:
#* Description or Comment field in a pop-up screen e.g. Create, Edit, or Transition screens
#* Attach Files or Log Work dialog
# Keyboard shortcut can still be used for Attach Screenshots dialog as usual
{panel}

h4. +Usage Improvement+
Other than that, when point 1 above is utilized, the following behaviors are observed:
# upon using Keyboard shortcut e.g. Ctrl+V, Attach Screenshots dialog is popped up to attach the pasted image
# once done, a wiki image link is automatically added to the field in focus, Description or Comment, in this format: {{\!screenshot-1.png!}}

This is not so helpful as it will render the whole big screenshot, and users will usually have to manually insert {{|thumbnail}} to have the image rendered as thumbnail.

*Suggestion*: the wiki image link should be added as {{\!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!}}
fields.summary: Clarify usage of Paste Images and Improve its usage
Mention Confluence Links in "Clone Issue" documentation

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Setup an Application Link to Confluence
# Create two pages in Confluence. Restrict one of them to your admin user
# Setup links to both these pages on the backlog via *Linked Pages > Create Link*
# Create a new user in JIRA and access the backlog page

*Expected Results:*
The unrestricted page should display its page name, and the restricted page should say something like "restricted page".

*Actual Results:*
The unrestricted page displays without issue, but the restricted page displays: "Page failed to load."
fields.summary: Links to restricted Confluence pages on the backlog display as 'Page failed to load.'

fields.description:
Jira is throwing connection timeout exception when 6 or more users are trying to fetch 1000 issues using jql search.

Sample request:
/rest/api/2/search?maxResults=1000&jql=project = 1800-MY.COM ORDER BY component ASC, Colors DESC, VersionNumbers ASC, Browser DESC, Servers ASC, resolution DESC, status ASC

Please note that all the fields mentioned above(i.e. component, Colors, VersionNumbers, Browser, Servers, resolution, status) are custom fields.

The surprising thing here is that if a simple jql(for eg. "project = 1800-MY.com") is used instead of a complex jql(as mentioned above), everything works fine even with 8 concurrent users.

The java memory setting in Jira was Xmx 1280MB and it was setup using mysql 5.5.21 database.
fields.summary: Jira rest call fails for multiple users and a complex JQL with 1000 record limit

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-44010].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description
Importing backup into from JIRA Cloud to JIRA Server fails

h3. Environment
Cloud backup generated on 2015/06/24 (JIRA-backup-20150624)

h3. Expected Behavior 
Restore process should be successful from Cloud XML back to JIRA Server

h3. Actual Behavior 

Restore process fails with the below error in the UI
{code}
The file you are trying to import is from JIRA 6.5-OD-07-005, which is newer than your current version of JIRA and will not work. The import file claims it can be successfully imported into JIRA 6.3.12 or later.

If JIRA 6.3.12 is not yet available for download, please contact support.
{code}

!importerror.png|thumbnail!

This might be due to change of downgrade logic in 6.4.6.

h3. Workaround 

Try to restore the XML back up from the Cloud on fresh copy of JIRA 6.4.5
Enter the license when you restore it on JIRA 6.4.5
!JIRA_645_workaround .png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Importing JIRA Cloud to JIRA Server 6.4.7 Fails

fields.description:
We were previously running Jira 6.3.x, I think 6.3.7 or so. We upgraded to 6.4.7.

Now, when a sub-task of an issue is Resolved (and almost certainly other events, as well), when an email is sent according to the project's notification scheme, the issue key in the email is the parent's key, instead of the sub-task that actually transitioned. This is quite confusing, especially if multiple sub-tasks for a single issue are being transitioned to different states around the same time, as you will receive multiple separate emails each indicating the issue has been resolved / closed / put in progress etc.

This seems to be a clear regression in behaviour since Jira 6.3.x.
fields.summary: After upgrading to 6.4.7, email notifications are not properly sent for sub-tasks

Upload your own avatar and assign it to custom issue type. You can also re-upload same avatar from standard issue type if you want to have the same icon.

h3. Workaround #2

[^rename.sh]

h3. Description
[System information|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Viewing+your+System+Information] is viewable by a JIRA administrator, however it has no simple way to export that information.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to choose an option for Status (Released, Unreleased) in IE 11, the checkbox has to be clicked multiple times to actually tick/choose the option. 

h3. Environment
* IE 11 
* JIRA 6.4.6

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Project Administration > Releases. (this page will only exist if you have created any Version for your Project)
# Click on the button for Status filter.
# Tick the checkbox for "Unreleased".

h3. Expected Results
Be able to choose/tick the checkbox with one click.

h3. Actual Results
Need to click multiple times to tick/choose the option. Refer the video clip here: http://screencast.com/t/Wk2EnPdh

h3. Notes
Problem doesn't occur in Chrome and Firefox.

h3.Workaround
No workaround except to use different browser or click multiple times to choose the option.
fields.summary: Options have to be clicked multiple times to filter by Status in the Releases page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43987].
  {panel}

h4. Actual Behaviour
At the moment, there's no way to actually display the work logged within an issue in a certain date range using the existing time tracking functionality built into JIRA. 

h4. Requested Behaviour
The desired behaviour is to filter Issues to show only hours logged in a particular time period as it will allows user to generate accurate customer reports for a given time period using *JIRA Dashboards* which rely on Issue filters.

h4. Workaround
Export all data to Excel and manipulate the data there.
fields.summary: Filter Issues to show only hours logged in a particular time period

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43986].
  {panel}

A lot of open source projects that are using JIRA use the voting mechanism (as a popularity measure) as one of the guidance signals for feature prioritisation.
However in order to be able to vote a user needs to be loggend-in which prevents a lot of users to perform a vote - thats especially the case for users who just came by via a google search.

It would be helpful to have an additional measurement to approximate the popularity of a particular feature request or bug. One such measurement you be simple to expose the hit-count (e.g. how often was this particular issue requested) - this is be a simple measure that should be easy to collect which would improve the "popularity" signal for a particular issue.

It should be possible to see this the hit-count in detail- as well as list-view. It should also be exposed via the REST API.
fields.summary: Introduce issue hit-counter or make it available as field.
